org.cloudcoder.daemon

Class Upgrade

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudcoder.daemon.Upgrade

  • public class Upgrade
extends java.lang.Object
    Upgrade a single-jarfile executable to the latest version, copying any needed configuration files into the new jarfile. Assumes that
    • the jarfile has a file called VERSION in its root directory that contains the version string of the current jarfile
    • the jarfile is named ${baseName}-${version}.jar, where ${version} is the version string in the VERSION file, and ${baseName} is some arbitrary base name (e.g., "cloudcoderApp")
    • there is a file ${downloadUrl}/LATEST that contains the latest application version string
    • that ${downloadUrl}/${baseName}-${latestVersion}.jar is the download for the latest version (where ${latestVersion} is the version string found in ${downloadUrl}/LATEST
    Author:
    David Hovemeyer

      static interface  Upgrade.Callback
      Callback interface for upgrade events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Upgrade

        public Upgrade(java.lang.String baseName,
       java.lang.String downloadUrl,
       java.lang.Class<?> appCls)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        baseName - the app jarfile's expected base name
        downloadUrl - the download URL
        appCls - the main class of the application (which must be loaded from the jarfile that is being upgraded)

    • Method Detail

      • addConfigFile

        public void addConfigFile(java.lang.String configFile)
        Add the name of a configuration file that should be copied from the current jarfile to the upgraded jarfile. Useful for configuration properties, keystores, etc.
        Parameters:
        configFile - name of configuration file to copy from current jar file to upgraded jar file

      • upgradeJarFile

        public void upgradeJarFile(Upgrade.Callback callback)
        Get a jarfile that is the latest version of the application, copying over all required configuration files to the upgraded jar file.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback for status updates, error or success indication, etc.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the download or configuration fails
